festival.introText:
Following the success and positive feedback of the 2022 edition, 51st Festival is excited to announce it will return to Copthall Playing Fields for 2023 on the original earlier August date, Saturday 5th August.

51st Festival returns to its new home at Copthall Playing Fields, which is easily accessible by tube (Mill Hill East on the Northern Line), train (Mill Hill Broadway, 17 minutes from King’s Cross St Pancras), bus (Copthall Sports Centre) and by car with plenty of parking available.

51st Festival will once again celebrate the roots of House music, pulling together the threads of this hugely influential sound, exploring classic house, tech house, afro house, garage, disco, soul, dancehall and more. Your favourite pioneers from Chicago, New York, Detroit, London and beyond will be joined by the trailblazers of today. The 51st Festival program is truly transatlantic, joining the dots between the US, the UK, Europe and the Caribbean.

51st Festival 2023 - a celebration of real House music!
festival.descriptionText: Skiddle is an official ticket outlet of 51st Festival. Get 51st Festival tickets, news and information with Skiddle.com

reviews.title: Review of 51st Festival 2022
reviews.body:
I love the fact that it was a new venue for the 51st State Festival and for me coming into London from the North the access was brilliant. 

The food and drinks were definitely overpriced although there was a good selection. 

I really enjoyed the different tents with varying genre which had me tent hopping but all in all the people and the atmosphere was amazzzziiiing

reviews.title: Review of 51st Festival 2022
reviews.body: Was a great atmosphere with grown up and sensible attendees. The Firing Squad, Rampage and Fabio Groove Rider were amazing. The PA's by Damage, Janet Kay, Mica Paris and Light of the World were simply fantastic. I loved that there were different tents so you could find the grove you wanted but also that the PA time slots didn't clash. brilliantly organised.

reviews.title: Review of 51st Festival 2022
reviews.body: VIP was a let down. The entrance into the venue was exactly into same area and yet the wait was longer to get in from the VIP lane to get in.? Way overpriced. Last year entrance was separate so you felt you got something more as you entered that area and it was quick. Should have more toilet facilities as the wait was longer in that section. And yet they were not clean. The VIP section was closed too early at the end of the night. Security was choosing to only let some people in to use the toilet at the end of the night. Other then that music was good.

reviews.title: Review of 51st Festival 2022
reviews.body:
I hadva great time on a standard ticket.. organised queueing  on entry this time and thank god no tokens required for drinks. not over crowded. good amount of toilets and regular cleaning. not over crowded.I'm not sure if this was due to some people attending originals festival which is the same day and similar music or if if its a larger space at this location.
only negative I've heard from a few people was certain staff were OTT on the body searching and being a bit to touchy on the men.

faqs.question: When is 51stFestival 2023?
faqs.answer: 51st Festival takes place on Saturday 5th August 2023.

faqs.question: Does 51st Festival have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: No, 51st Festival is a non-camping festival so camping equipment is not needed, however, there is plenty of alternative accommodation to choose from.

faqs.question: How much are 51st Festival tickets?
faqs.answer: Standard tickets are available from £32.50 plus booking fee and VIP tickets start from £65 plus booking fee.

faqs.question: How do I get to 51st State?
faqs.answer:
By Tube - by Tube (Mill Hill East on the Northern Line)

By Car - Copthall Playing Fields are just 400 metres from Junction 2 of the M1, 12 minutes inside the M25 and right next to the North Circular Road. There is car parking space for 800 cars on a first come first serve basis, car park tickets are only available in advance here: 51stfestival.com/blogs/tickets The A1(M) runs from the North of England down into north London, via nearby towns such as Stevenage, Welwyn Garden City and Hatfield. The A406 (the North Circular Road) runs through north London and links west and east London together. The M1 runs from the North of England into north London, via Luton and Watford.


By Taxi - There will be a taxi rank for collections, this will be sign-posted on the day of the event. Please be aware that there are strict road closures in operation in the surrounding areas which only allow access to local residents.

By Bus - The 221 route runs from Edgware bus station to Turnpike Lane station. Alight at the Copthall Sports Centre for the Copthall Playing Fields, which is a 5 minute walk away. The 113 Bus route runs from Edgware Bus Station to Marble Arch. Alight at Five Ways Corner for Copthall Playing Fields, which is a 10 minute walk away.

 

By Train - The nearest train station is Mill Hill Broadway which is on Thameslink and a 5 minute taxi journey from Copthall Playing Fields. Mill Hill Broadway is only 17 minutes from King’s Cross St Pancras or 20 minutes from Farringdon.

faqs.question: Is there disabled access at 51st State Festival?
faqs.answer:
51st State provide a free ticket for a personal assistant to special access ticket holders who would be unable to attend or whose experience would be greatly impaired without their presence.

Please follow the steps below to apply.

Application Process

Please purchase the tickets you require for 51st Festival via Skiddle, NOT including the Carer Ticket.

We then ask you to supply us with one of the following documents dated within the past 12 months or with valid date covering the event:

-The front page of the DLA letter with the PIP letter

-The front page of Attendance Allowance letter

-Evidence of being registered as severely sight impaired (blind)

-Recognised Assistance Dog ID card

-Valid Access Card showing you require a +1 to accompany you

 

If you could email the supporting document and your Skiddle order ID number to custcare@skiddle.com we can add a Personal Assistant ticket to your order.

faqs.question: Where is 51st Festival?
faqs.answer: 51st Festival takes place at Copthall Playing Fields in Mill Hill / Barnet.  The postcode is NW4 1PS.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately, we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.

 

Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Does 51stFestival have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Yes you must be 18 or over to attend 51st Festival. You may be asked to show photo ID.

faqs.question: How do I access my tickets?
faqs.answer: You can access your RapidScan tickets at any time by logging into www.skiddle.com/orders or by heading to the 'my tickets' section on the Skiddle app.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into 51st Festival?
faqs.answer: You are not allowed to bring your own food and drink into 51st Festival. There will be a wide variety of food and drink stalls inside the festival.

faqs.question: What are the set times?
faqs.answer: These are generally finalised much closer to the festival.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of 51st Festival 2022
reviewsDisplayFour.body:
I love the fact that it was a new venue for the 51st State Festival and for me coming into London from the North the access was brilliant. 

The food and drinks were definitely overpriced although there was a good selection. 

I really enjoyed the different tents with varying genre which had me tent hopping but all in all the people and the atmosphere was amazzzziiiing

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of 51st Festival 2022
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Was a great atmosphere with grown up and sensible attendees. The Firing Squad, Rampage and Fabio Groove Rider were amazing. The PA's by Damage, Janet Kay, Mica Paris and Light of the World were simply fantastic. I loved that there were different tents so you could find the grove you wanted but also that the PA time slots didn't clash. brilliantly organised.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of 51st Festival 2022
reviewsDisplayFour.body: I come to this festival every year I enjoy myself, the music was great in all tents. It did feel that there was more space in the park.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of 51st Festival 2022
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Disappointed one artist did not come.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of 51st Festival 2022
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Best thing I been to this year, back to 95 tent was the place to be. Sound system wasn't all that but everything eles was amazing

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of 51st Festival 2022
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Great but I usually get a carers ticket as I have a disability, I emailed you guys and you said email the organisers, I had no email address so I sent a Facebook message, noond responded. so, I went alone and had a panic attack on the way so I got there very late. this was very upsetting.

news.title: 51st Festival 2023 is on sale now
news.summary: 51st Festival have announced that tickets for their 2023 edition are on sale now.

news.title: 51st Festival launch phase 2 lineup
news.summary: 51st Festival is back in 2022 after a hugely successful edition in 2021. They're looking to go bigger and better than ever.

news.title: 51st  Festival announce first phase of lineup
news.summary: 51st Festival announces the first names for its 2022 edition.
